Lack of market research: Without proper research, it may be difficult to determine the viability of the business idea or identify potential customers.
Competitive market: Being in a competitive market can be challenging, and it may be difficult to differentiate the business and gain a competitive advantage.
Legal compliance: Starting a new business may require compliance with various legal regulations, including tax compliance, licenses, and permits, which can be time-consuming and costly.
Difficulty in getting investors: Investors may be hesitant to invest in a new business due to risks associated with it, making it difficult to secure funding.
Staff recruitment: Finding and hiring suitable staff can be difficult and time-consuming, especially in the initial stages of the business.
